title: Does IGNOU notes on BA and MA public administration help for optional public administration in the UPSC? - Quora
tags: Union Public Service Commission of India

response.answer_text: Yes …! They certainly very helpful. Because Ignou Study materials are prepared by the best in the field. They are prepared by Phd holders. Infact many candidates who have passed UPSC exams have given credit to Ignou. Because they were simultaneously studying some PG course from Ignou or were past candidates on Ignou. Surf the web. Many passed candidates have been interviewed by Times of India. And they have mentioned Ignou’s study materials as their best friend. I thinks its due to the fact that Ignou’s study materials are prepared for self study. So they are easy to understand. Plus they don’t compromise with quality. And they are also available on their egyankosh website. Its FREE for all. You can download them or buy them from their study centre/regional centre (present in every Big city) for a small price. I have personally read Ignou study materials for MAsters in Economics and Public Administration. I really liked them. Ignou is a university created by the Act of parliament 1985. Beware of other fake universities.

IGNOU notes for any subject help immensely while preparing for any optional. For one , they give you a good idea of what the subject matter constitutes and secondly, they are the base on which you start preparing your optional. You start reading other books after you are done with reading IGNOU notes. However, not all modules of the notes are useful for the UPSC optional, so always read selectively.

Dear Ajeet, Quality of IGNOU study material is no doubt is of very high quality but i do not have any idea whether ignou notes in public administration will help you in UPSC preparation or not. I have never prepared for UPSC but you can post your query on Mrunal - Competitive exams Preparationit is a specialised site for preparation of UPSC.
Ba is passe. MA, admin. Theory is the best. Must read.
MA will be a great help.
